comments:
Avoid over-claiming “mitochondrial biogenesis”; say “increased mitochondrial signal consistent with increased mitochondrial content or activity” unless validated.

Report per-well/per-plate effect sizes; do not rely on cell-level p-values (pseudo-replication). Use mixed-effects or aggregate-then-test.

Analyze more wells and sites (you listed many); show robustness across JCP IDs, plates, and sites.

Add object-based mitochondrial metrics (mito area, count, fragmentation/network texture) not just intensity.

Disambiguate mito mass vs membrane potential (eg MitoTracker Green vs Red, TOMM20/COXIV IF, mtDNA copy number).

Control for cell cycle (DNA content bins) when comparing mito/RNA/ER; report stratified effects.

Sanity-check segmentation and illumination; include QC plots (cell size, edge-cell removal, stain intensity distributions).

Treat extreme fold-changes in preprocessed texture features as ranking signals; avoid quoting huge fold changes without explaining scaling/near-zero denominators.

Tighten “metabolic reprogramming” language; link RNA/ER decreases to “reduced anabolic state” and specify alternative explanations (cell cycle, staining).

Validate proliferation claims with a direct proxy (EdU/Ki67 or growth curve); cell count in images is suggestive only.

Add a “specificity” check: compare to related perturbations (other sirtuins, HIF1A, PGC1A pathway genes) and show SIRT6 is distinct.

Keep longevity framing in Discussion with citations; don’t present it as a direct conclusion from morphology alone.
